anvil.api.Config

Class ConfigFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • anvil.api.Config.ConfigFile

  • public class ConfigFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a file where configurable options are available.

    All ConfigFile objects should be loaded while all PlugIns are loaded, so they should be built in the PlugIn.onLoad() method. For more information on building a ConfigFile object, see addOption(ConfigOption).

    For organization, it is a good idea to name the config file itself along with the name of the PlugIn.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Garrett Stonis
    See Also:
    ConfigOption

    • Method Detail

      • addOption

        public boolean addOption(ConfigOption option)
        Adds a ConfigOption to the list of stored ConfigOptions. Each one will appear in the file and be configurable.

        This method is a crucial part of "building" the ConfigFile. Building the ConfigFile means adding the all necessary ConfigOption objects to represent the file. This is best to be done in the PlugIn.onLoad() method of the PlugIn. This is also a good time to add ConfigOptions to the main ConfigFile.

        Once added, these options cannot be removed.

        Parameters:
        option - ConfigOption object containing the option to add.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the add was successful. False if an option with the same title already exists.
        See Also:
        ConfigOption

      • getOption

        public ConfigOption getOption(java.lang.String title)
        Gets the ConfigOption object associated with the given title.

        Note: This method returns the actual ConfigOption stored by this ConfigFile. Any changes made to the option will affect the object for the rest of Anvil's run-time.

        Parameters:
        title - String object containing the title of the ConfigOption to get.
        Returns:
        ConfigOption object containing the desired option. Null if the title doesn't exist in this ConfigFile object.

      • getOptions

        public ConfigOption[] getOptions()
        Gets the ConfigOptions stored in the ConfigFile.

        Note: This method returns the actual ConfigOptions stored by this ConfigFile. Any changes made to the options will affect them for the rest of Anvil's run-time.

        Returns:
        ConfigOption array containing every option.

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile()
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads the file given in the constructor and updates the ConfigOption list with the stored values. This only updates the currentValue property of the related ConfigOption.

        This method is designed to be run after the user has already built the ConfigFile. See addOption(ConfigOption) for more information on building a ConfigFile. The main config file is automatically read after all PlugIn.onLoad() methods have run; any other config files need to be read manually.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When a required field is empty, or the field isn't built into the ConfigFile.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - When the given file in the constructor doesn't exist.

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile()
        Saves the stored values of the ConfigOptions list to the file given in the constructor. If a ConfigOption's currentValue is empty/null, the defaultValue will be written instead.

        If the file already exists, every option's value will be overwritten, but comments and positioning will be left untouched. If the file doesn't exist yet, all titles, values, and comments will be written.

        This method is designed to be run after the user has already built the ConfigFile. See addOption(ConfigOption) for more information on building a ConfigFile.
